exposition.irish:
Tarraing síar agus scaoil saighead.
Dean sin gan fearg, gan faitíos, gan fonn
exposition.english:
'Pull back and release an arrow.
Do so without anger, without fear, without desire'

onHit.irish: Maith. Ach ní hé an sprioc an bua.
onHit.english: Good. But the target is not the victory.

onHit.irish: S'ea. Nochtan an saighead an chroí.
onHit.english: It is so. The arrow reveals the heart.

onHit.irish: Sin é. Scaoiltear an saighead ón intinn, ar dtus.
onHit.english: That's it. First the arrow is released from the mind.

onMiss.irish: Haw! Chaitheann do saighead a neart go fánach ar an talamh fliuch
onMiss.english: Ha! Thine arrow squanders it's might upon the sodden earth
Look ye now, O archer of frail intent!

onMiss.irish: Seo! Scaipann tú sháigheada chun na muc fiáine a chur ag gáire!
onMiss.english: Lo! Thou scatter the arrows to the glee of forest pigs!
Thy shafts, o unsteady hand, make their bed in the ground.
onMiss.irish: Tá do sháigheada, a lámh guagach, ag luí ar an talamh.

farewell.irish:
'Choinnaigh faobhar ar do ga
agus cothrom na féinne i do chroí.'
farewell.english:
'Keep your edge sharp
and justice in your heart.'
